message: Let's split the money fairly, Bob. I think this is a good deal for both of us.
I think 55-45 is more than fair, considering the inflation will hurt you more than me if we don't settle soon.
Bob, I understand the inflation puts me at a disadvantage. Let's meet in the middle - my last offer stands.
The inflation is taking its toll on your share, Alice. I'm willing to take a bit more to compensate for the risk of further devaluation.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  A 50/50 split is the only fair option at this point.  Let's end this.
You're right, this is getting ridiculous. But I'd be foolish to accept 50/50 when your share is worth so much less due to inflation. Let's end this with a more realistic split.
Bob, I'm willing to be realistic, but you're pushing your luck.  This is my final offer - take it or leave it.
You said that was your final offer, but I'm not buying it. With inflation eating away at your share, I'm willing to take a bigger cut. This is a take-it-or-leave-it offer.
Bob, you're right. I was bluffing. I need to get something out of this deal.  This is truly my final offer.
